effects: When you assume Wild Shape, you gain these benefits:
Challenge Rating: the forms maximum CR equals your druid level divided by 3 (round down).
Armor Class: your AC equals 13 + your Wisdom modifier if higher than the beasts AC.
Temporary Hit Points: you gain temporary hit points equal to three times your druid level.
You always have the spells in the Circle of the Moon Spells table prepared at the druid levels shown.
You can cast these spells while in Wild Shape.

feature_defs.trigger: while you are in Wild Shape
effects: Lunar Radiance: your Wild Shape attacks can deal their normal damage type or radiant damage (choose on each hit).
Increased Toughness: you add your Wisdom modifier to Constitution saving throws.
You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
You have advantage on the next attack roll you make before the end of this turn.
limits: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You can restore uses by expending a level 2+ spell slot for each use (no action required).

effects: Improved Lunar Radiance: once per turn, you can deal an extra 2d10 radiant damage to a target you hit with a Wild Shape attack.
Shared Moonlight: when you use Moonlight Step, you can also teleport one willing creature within 10 feet of you to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of your destination.
